model.description: Overview of where traffic to your API originates

targets.rawSql: SELECT country, count(requestId) as requests FROM ${table} WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) GROUP BY country LIMIT 1000

model.title: Geographic Request Distribution

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    count(requestId) AS total_requests
FROM ${table}
WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp)

model.description: The total number of API requests per day (default time range is 14 days)

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    toDate(timestamp) AS date,  -- Extract the date part
    count(*) AS daily_requests   -- Count requests for each day
FROM ${table}
WHERE timestamp >= toDateTime(now() - INTERVAL 14 DAY) AND timestamp <= toDateTime(now()) -- customized to used fixed values
GROUP BY date                   -- Group by date
ORDER BY date ASC              -- Order by date

model.title: Requests Per Day (Fixed 14 Days)

model.description: Request response times as Median, Average and P95

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    toStartOfMinute(timestamp) AS time, -- Time bucket (adjust as needed)
    quantile(0.5)(durationMs) AS median_duration,
    avg(durationMs) AS average_duration,
    quantile(0.95)(durationMs) AS p95_duration
FROM ${table}
WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp)
GROUP BY time
ORDER BY time ASC

model.title: Request Response Time

cecxpyk5wt7nkf.name: Zuplo: Top 20 Requests by Route Path

model.description: The top 10 routes that demand the most trafic.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    routePath,
    count(*) AS request_count
FROM ${table}
WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp)  -- Grafana time filter (essential)
GROUP BY routePath
ORDER BY request_count DESC
LIMIT 10

model.title: Top 10 Routes by Request Count

decxpz3jy0g74d.name: Zuplo: Total Request Distribution by Method

model.description: Overall view of the proportion of different HTTP methods in use.

targets.rawSql: SELECT method, count(method) as method_requests FROM ${table} WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) GROUP BY method LIMIT 1000

model.title: Total Request Distribution by Method

model.description: Overview of the average request durations

targets.rawSql: SELECT $__timeInterval(timestamp) as time, avg(durationMs) as Request_Duration FROM ${table} WHERE ( time >= $__fromTime AND time <= $__toTime ) GROUP BY time ORDER BY time ASC LIMIT 1000

model.title: Average API Request Duration

model.description: The IP Addresses that are making the most requests

targets.rawSql: SELECT clientIP, requestId, count(requestId) as request_count FROM ${table} GROUP BY clientIP, requestId ORDER BY request_count DESC LIMIT 10

model.title: Top 10 Requesting IP Addresses

decxq1bd5pukgf.name: Zuplo: Percentage of Requests Rate Limited (Gauge)

model.description: What percentage of requests are subject to a 429

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    (COUNT(CASE WHEN statusCode = 429 THEN 1 END) * 100) / COUNT(*) AS rate_limited_percentage
FROM ${table}
WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp)

model.title: Percentage of Requests Rate Limited

model.description: How many requests are being processed of what HTTP status code

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    toStartOfMinute(timestamp) AS time,
    CASE WHEN statusCode = 200 THEN count(*) ELSE 0 END AS "200",  -- Success
    CASE WHEN statusCode = 400 THEN count(*) ELSE 0 END AS "400",  -- Bad Request
    CASE WHEN statusCode = 401 THEN count(*) ELSE 0 END AS "401",  -- Unauthorized
    CASE WHEN statusCode = 403 THEN count(*) ELSE 0 END AS "403",  -- Forbidden
    CASE WHEN statusCode = 404 THEN count(*) ELSE 0 END AS "404",  -- Not Found
    CASE WHEN statusCode = 429 THEN count(*) ELSE 0 END AS "429",  -- Too Many Requests (Rate Limiting)
    CASE WHEN statusCode = 500 THEN count(*) ELSE 0 END AS "500",  -- Internal Server Error
    CASE WHEN statusCode = 502 THEN count(*) ELSE 0 END AS "502",  -- Bad Gateway
    CASE WHEN statusCode = 503 THEN count(*) ELSE 0 END AS "503",  -- Service Unavailable
    CASE WHEN statusCode = 504 THEN count(*) ELSE 0 END AS "504"   -- Gateway Timeout
FROM ${table}
WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp)  -- Important for Grafana time range
GROUP BY time, statusCode
ORDER BY time ASC

model.title: Requests by Status Code

model.description: What percentage of requests are being made by unauthorized clients

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    (COUNT(CASE WHEN statusCode = 401 THEN 1 END) * 100) / COUNT(*) AS unauthorized_percentage
FROM ${table}
WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp)

model.title: Percentage of Requests Unauthorized (401)

model.description: How many HTTP status errors between 40x and 50x are being seen

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    toStartOfMinute(timestamp) AS time,
    CASE
        WHEN statusCode = 400 THEN count(*)  -- Count 400 errors
        ELSE 0                               -- Other status codes
    END AS "400",  -- Alias for 400 errors
    CASE
        WHEN statusCode = 401 THEN count(*)  -- Count 401 errors
        ELSE 0
    END AS "401",  -- Alias for 401 errors
    --... Add similar CASE statements for other status codes...
    CASE
        WHEN statusCode = 500 THEN count(*)  -- Count 500 errors
        ELSE 0
    END AS "500"   -- Alias for 500 errors
FROM ${table}
WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) AND statusCode BETWEEN 400 AND 599
GROUP BY time, statusCode
ORDER BY time ASC

model.title: Error Rates

model.description: The geographic location of API requests

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    latitude,
    longitude,
    CASE
        WHEN percentage < 5 THEN 1  -- Band 1
        WHEN percentage >= 5 AND percentage < 10 THEN 2  -- Band 2
        WHEN percentage >= 10 AND percentage < 20 THEN 3  -- Band 3
        WHEN percentage >= 20 AND percentage < 30 THEN 4  -- Band 4
        WHEN percentage >= 30 AND percentage < 40 THEN 5  -- Band 5
        WHEN percentage >= 40 AND percentage < 50 THEN 6  -- Band 6
        WHEN percentage >= 50 AND percentage < 60 THEN 7  -- Band 7
        WHEN percentage >= 60 AND percentage < 70 THEN 8  -- Band 8
        WHEN percentage >= 70 AND percentage < 80 THEN 9  -- Band 9
        WHEN percentage >= 80 AND percentage < 90 THEN 10  -- Band 10
        WHEN percentage >= 90 AND percentage <= 100 THEN 11  -- Band 9
        ELSE 0  -- Default (shouldn't happen)
    END AS percentage_band, percentage
FROM (
    SELECT
        latitude,
        longitude,
        ROUND((request_count / sum(request_count) OVER ()) * 100, 2) AS percentage  -- Round to 2 decimal places
    FROM (
        SELECT
            latitude,
            longitude,
            count(*) AS request_count
        FROM ${table}
        WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp)
        GROUP BY latitude, longitude
    )
)
ORDER BY percentage_band

model.title: Traffic Location Geo

model.description: The colocation node that requests are hitting

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    colo,
    count(*) AS request_count
FROM (
    SELECT
        colo,
        *
    FROM ${table}
)
WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp)
GROUP BY colo
ORDER BY request_count DESC
LIMIT 20

model.title: Requests by Colo/IATA (Top 20)

targets.builderOptions: The query is not a select statement.

meta.builderOptions: The query is not a select statement.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    city,
    count(*) AS request_count
FROM (
    SELECT
        city,  -- Assuming you have a 'city' column in your table
        *
    FROM ${table}
)
WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp)
GROUP BY city
ORDER BY request_count DESC
LIMIT 10

model.description: Which timezone is the most active in terms of requests

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    timezone,
    (count(*) * 100) / (SELECT count(*) FROM "sbxzuplotwist"."zuplotest" WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp)) AS percentage
FROM "sbxzuplotwist"."zuplotest"
WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp)
GROUP BY timezone
ORDER BY percentage DESC
LIMIT 5

model.title: Current Most Active Timezones

model.description: The distribution of request traffic on each colo node using their IATA designation

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    colo AS colo_with_percentage,
    count(*) AS request_count,
    (count(*) * 100) / (SELECT count(*) FROM "sbxzuplotwist"."zuplotest" WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp)) AS percentage
FROM ${table}
WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp)
GROUP BY colo
ORDER BY request_count DESC

model.title: Traffic Distribution (Colo/IATA)

dashboard.description: Everything available, all in one place!

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    time,
    requests / (toUInt64(time) - toUInt64(neighbor(time, -1, toDateTime64(0, 3)))) AS rps  -- Corrected type handling
FROM (
    SELECT
        toStartOfSecond(timestamp) AS time,  -- Time bucket (adjust as needed)
        count(*) AS requests
    FROM "sbxzuplotwist"."zuplotest"
    WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp)
    GROUP BY time
    ORDER BY time ASC
)
